results.title: Simvastatin impairs exercise training adaptations.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ attenuates increases in cardiorespiratory fitness and skeletal muscle mitochondrial content when combined with exercise training in @<m>DISEASE_Overweight</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050177 @@@overweight@@@ or @DISEASE_Obesity @DISEASE_MESH:D009765 @@@obese@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ at risk of the @DISEASE_Metabolic_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D024821 @@@metabolic syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Mikus CR, Boyle LJ, Borengasser SJ, Oberlin DJ, Naples SP, Fletcher J, Meers GM, Ruebel M, Laughlin MH, Dellsperger KC, Fadel PJ, Thyfault JP. Simvastatin impairs exercise training adaptations. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2013 Aug 20;62(8):709-14. PMID: 23583255

results.title: A pilot comprehensive lifestyle intervention program (CLIP)--comparison with qualitative lifestyle advice and simvastatin on cardiovascular risk factors in overweight hypercholesterolaemic individuals.
results.text_hl: A pilot comprehensive lifestyle intervention program (CLIP)--comparison with qualitative lifestyle advice and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ on cardiovascular risk factors in @<m>DISEASE_Overweight</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050177 @@@overweight@@@ hypercholesterolaemic individuals.

citations.NLM: Cleanthous X, Noakes M, Brinkworth GD, Keogh JB, Williams G, Clifton PM. A pilot comprehensive lifestyle intervention program (CLIP)--comparison with qualitative lifestyle advice and simvastatin on cardiovascular risk factors in overweight hypercholesterolaemic individuals. Nutr Metab Cardiovasc Dis. 2011 Mar;21(3):165-72. PMID: 20110160

results.title: Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Achieving Very Low Levels of Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol : A Prespecified Analysis of the IMPROVE-IT Trial.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ with LDL-C values less than 30 mg/dL (median, 25 mg/dL; interquartile range, 21-27 mg/dL) at 1 month were more likely randomized to @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@/@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (85%), had lower baseline LDL-C values, and were more likely older, male, nonwhite, @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Overweight</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D050177 @@@overweight@@@, statin naive, and presenting with a first @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@.

citations.NLM: Giugliano RP, Wiviott SD, Blazing MA, De Ferrari GM, Park JG, Murphy SA, White JA, Tershakovec AM, Cannon CP, Braunwald E. Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Achieving Very Low Levels of Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol : A Prespecified Analysis of the IMPROVE-IT Trial. JAMA Cardiol. 2017 May 1;2(5):547-555. PMID: 28291866
citations.BibTeX: @article{28291866, title={Long-term Safety and Efficacy of Achieving Very Low Levels of Low-Density Lipoprotein Cholesterol : A Prespecified Analysis of the IMPROVE-IT Trial.}, author={Giugliano RP and Wiviott SD and Blazing MA and De Ferrari GM and Park JG and Murphy SA and White JA and Tershakovec AM and Cannon CP and Braunwald E}, journal={JAMA Cardiol}, volume={2}, number={5}, pages={547-555}}
